1.Details: You received a letter from the local wizard. He claims to have information regarding the old community center.
1.Title: Meet The Wizard

2.Details: Within a secret lock-box, you found a note with peculiar instructions. It's signed by a 'Mr. Qi'.
2.Hint: Leave a rainbow shell in the box at the train platform.
2.Title: The Mysterious Qi

3.Details: You've found another note written by 'Mr. Qi'. The request is even more unusual this time.
3.Hint: Place 10 beets inside Mayor Lewis' fridge.
3.Title: The Mysterious Qi

4.Details: You've found yet another strange note within the Mayor's fridge. This time, the instructions are more cryptic.
4.Hint: "Give the sand dragon his final meal."
4.Title: The Mysterious Qi

5.Details: You found another note in the sand dragon's eye. It seems Mr. Qi's strange scavenger hunt has come to an end.
5.Hint: Inspect the lumber pile beside your house.
5.Title: The Mysterious Qi

6.Details: If you want to become a farmer, you have to start with the basics. Use your hoe to till the soil, then use a seed packet on the tilled soil to sow a crop. Water every day until the crop is ready for harvest.
6.Title: Getting Started

7.Details: Robin, the local carpenter, lives north of town. In exchange for raw materials and money, she'll construct new buildings on your farm. You'll need her to build a coop or barn so that you can raise animals.
7.Title: Raising Animals

8.Details: As you gain experience, you'll discover new crafting recipes to increase profit and make life easier. A scarecrow, for example, will prevent crows from snacking on your precious crops.
8.Hint: Reach Farming level 1 and craft a scarecrow.
8.Title: Advancement

9.Details: It would be a nice gesture to introduce yourself around town. Some people might be anxious to meet the new farmer.
9.Title: Introductions

10.Details: You found a piece of copper ore. You're not sure what you can use it for, but the local blacksmith ought to know.
10.Hint: Bring a piece of copper ore to Clint's blacksmith shop.
10.Title: Copper Ore

11.Details: If you're going to keep mining, you should build a furnace.
11.Title: Forging Ahead

12.Details: Now that you've built a furnace, you can smelt some metal. According to Clint's instructions, if you place 5 copper ore and 1 piece of coal in the furnace, it should produce a copper bar.
12.Hint: Use your furnace to smelt a Copper Bar.
12.Title: Smelting

13.Details: Someone named Willy invited you to visit the beach south of town. He says he has something to give you.
13.Hint: Visit the beach south of town before 5:00pm.
13.Title: To The Beach

14.Details: There's an old mine shaft in the mountains north of town. There could be valuable minerals inside, but Marlon hinted that it might be dangerous.
14.Title: Explore The Mine

15.Details: If you can slay 10 slimes, you'll have earned your place in the Adventurer's Guild.
15.Title: Initiation

16.Details: You sucessfully dispatched 10 slimes. Now you can enter the Adventurer's Guild.
16.Title: Initiation

17.Details: It seems that the mine elevator is still functional. It will allow you to quickly return to any elevator doors you've discovered. A deeper expedition might be in order.
17.Title: Deeper In The Mine

18.Details: So far, there's no sign of the bottom. How low does it go?
18.Hint: Reach the bottom of the mine.
18.Title: To The Bottom?

19.Details: You found a strange looking key in the bottom of the mines.
19.Hint: Discover the purpose of the Skull Key.
19.Title: The Skull Key

20.Details: You've been challenged to reach level 25 in the skull cavern. You've been promised a substantial reward if you're successful.
20.Hint: Reach level 25 in the Skull Cavern.
20.Title: Qi's Challenge

21.Details: Marnie came by the farm and asked if you'd bring her a cave carrot. She's trying to train her goats to speak, and cave carrot is their favorite snack.
21.Hint: Bring a Cave Carrot into Marnie's shop.
21.Title: Marnie's Request

22.Details: Jodi swung by the farm to ask you to dinner at 7:00 PM. Her only request was that you bring a largemouth bass for her fish casserole.
22.Hint: Enter Jodi's house with a largemouth bass at 7:00 PM.
22.Title: Fish Casserole

23.Details: You found an ancient-looking object. Could it be some kind of artifact from long ago? Perhaps Gunther, curator of the local museum, has the answer.
23.Title: Archaeology

24.Details: Gunther asked if you'd consider donating any new artifacts or minerals you find to the museum. He says he'll compensate you by way of occasional rare goods.
24.Hint: Donate an artifact or a mineral to the museum.
24.Title: Archaeology

25.Details: Giving gifts is a great way to build friendships. Learn each person's individual tastes and you'll be popular in no time.
25.Title: How To Win Friends

26.Details: There's something odd going on in the Community Center...
26.Title: "Rat Problem"

27.Details: There's a goblin blocking the path to the Witch's hut. There must be some way to get him to move... Perhaps I should seek out more information on Goblins.
27.Hint: Gain entrance to the Witch's hut.
27.Title: Goblin Problem

28.Details: The Wizard asked me to retrieve the magic ink from his ex-wife's house... but to gain access I'll need a dark talisman.
28.Hint: Enter the sewer and ask Krobus about the dark talisman.
28.Title: Dark Talisman

29.Details: You found a note, barely legible, asking you to bring "may-pal serrup" to the "seecrit wuds".
29.Title: Strange Note

30.Details: You found a note that reads, "Someone is waiting for you on level 100 in the Skull Cavern"
30.Hint: Reach level 100 in the Skull Cavern
30.Title: Cryptic Note

31.Details: You encountered a suspicious looking figure by the bus stop. When it saw you, it fled toward town. Could there be a clue to its whereabouts?
31.Title: A Winter Mystery

100.Details: Robin lost her favorite axe. The last time she remembers using it, she was cutting wood south of Marnie's ranch.
100.Title: Robin's Lost Axe

101.Details: Jodi needs a fresh cauliflower for a recipe she's making. She's asking you to bring her one.
101.Title: Jodi's Request

102.Details: Mayor Lewis has lost his purple "shorts". He's asking you to find and return them... Discreetly.
102.Hint: Find and return Mayor Lewis' purple shorts.
102.Title: Mayor's "Shorts"

103.Details: Pam is hankerin' for a pale ale. Regular old beer won't do. You can brew one yourself if you have hops and a keg.
103.Title: Pam Is Thirsty

104.Details: Demetrius needs a fresh melon for his research.
104.Title: Crop Research

105.Details: George needs a hot pepper to soothe his aching knee.
105.Title: Knee Therapy

106.Details: Marnie wants to give her cows a special treat. She's asking for a single bunch of amaranth.
106.Hint: Bring Marnie one bunch of amaranth.
106.Title: Cow's Delight

107.Details: It's blackberry season, but Linus can't find his basket! He's asking you to help him find it. He has no idea where it is.
107.Hint: Find Linus' basket and return it to him.
107.Title: Blackberry Basket

108.Details: Caroline wants to carve a pumpkin with her daughter. She asked you to bring her one from the farm.
108.Title: Carving Pumpkins

109.Details: Willy is challenging you to catch a squid. He says you can fish them from the ocean on winter nights.
109.Title: Catch A Squid

110.Details: Clint wants you to give Emily an amethyst. He wants you to tell her it's from him.
110.Title: Clint's Attempt

111.Details: The wizard wants you to descend into the mines and fetch him a Void Essence. He needs it for some kind of dark magic.
111.Title: A Dark Reagent

112.Details: Clint got a new hammer and he wants to test it out on a variety of metals.
112.Title: A Favor For Clint

113.Details: Robin wrote to you asking for some hardwood.
113.Title: Robin's Request

114.Details: Gus wants to make fish stew, but he needs an albacore.
114.Title: Fish Stew

115.Details: Emily wants a taste of spring. She's asking for a fresh apricot.
115.Title: Fresh Fruit

116.Details: Evelyn wants to surprise her husband with a gift.
116.Title: Granny's Gift

117.Details: Pierre will pay "top coin" to whoever brings him a plate of sashimi. Apparently he's really craving the stuff.
117.Title: Pierre's Notice

118.Details: Demetrius is studying the toxin levels of the local pufferfish. He'd like you to bring him one.
118.Title: Aquatic Research

119.Details: Kent wants to give his wife a starfruit for their anniversary.
119.Title: A Soldier's Star

120.Details: Mayor Lewis wants truffle oil. He won't explain what it's for. Maybe it's none of your business.
120.Hint: Bring Lewis a bottle of Truffle Oil.
120.Title: Mayor's Need

121.Details: Gus put out a notice requesting a fresh lobster.
121.Title: Wanted: Lobster

122.Details: Pam's TV Remote is dead. She's having a tough time going back and forth between the couch and the TV dial.
122.Title: Pam Needs Juice

123.Details: The Wizard is creating a staff of phenomenal power. Who knows what it's for. He needs an iridium bar to finish it.
123.Title: Staff Of Power

124.Details: Willy is challenging you to catch a Lingcod.
124.Title: Catch a Lingcod

125.Details: Gus wants to make a Coco-no-no, but he's missing the main ingredient.
125.Title: Exotic Spirits

126.Details: Your wife asked you to bring her 200 pieces of fiber for a secret project.
126.Title: Errand for your Wife

127.Details: Your wife is organizing a charity cake-walk in the town square. She asked you to bring a chocolate cake.
127.Hint: Enter Town on a sunny morning with a chocolate cake.
127.Title: Haley's Cake-Walk

130.Details: An old lady living on Ginger Island is asking you to find a keepsake of her husband's. She gave you an old photograph of a soldier that washed up on shore, hoping it would help in some way.
130.Hint: Find a keepsake that belonged to Birdie's husband.
130.Title: The Pirate's Wife
